Quiz1.q: What is 3+3?
Quiz1.description: 3 + 3 equals to 6

Quiz1.q: Who was the first person to sail around the globe?
Quiz1.description: Ferdinand Magellan circumnavigated the globe in 1519 trying to discover another route to the rich spices of indonesia
9+6 = 15 thus this statement is false

Quiz1.description: 18+4 = 22. Simple math!!!

Quiz1.q: The longest ever veil was over 10 feet in length
Quiz1.description:
The longest veil ever warn to a wedding was 22,843 feet and 2.11 inches long. 
That is the same as 63.5 football fields

Quiz1.q: What goes up and never comes down?
Quiz1.description: Its age! Its only a one way deal.

Quiz1.q: How many Big East titles does the St. Johns Tennis Program have?
Quiz1.description: St. John's Men's Tennis won the big East Championship once in the 80s, once in the 90s, and four times in the past decade!

Quiz1.description: Chicago was called the Windy City because its residents were windbags!
